oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MODELLING THE CAISSON PLACEMENT AT THE CHIOGGIA INLET, VENICE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hofland, Bas
Vink, Nico
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Venice
flood barrier
physical modelling
immersion
caisson
MOSE
Chioggia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the summer of 2014 Strukton Immersion Projects has placed the foundation caissons of the Venice flood barrier in the Chioggia inlet to the Venice Lagoon. The caissons were loaded by currents and waves during placement. Before the placement, physical model tests were performed in a wave-current basin to optimize the placement procedure, and to determine the line force and pontoon motions. This paper describes the model setup, tests that were performed, the results and the implications for the placement procedure. Also the experiences during actual placement are discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.59
